title: Dow futures bounce around Tuesday evening after stock market ends at about 2-week low

title: Oil prices recover ground after market turmoil fuels price plunge

title: Explainer: Antitrust law will not get in the way of U.S. acting to raise oil prices

title: Oil prices continue plunge as coronavirus keeps market in a chokehold
text: Oil prices continued a historic plunge Tuesday as the coronavirus pandemic’s stranglehold on demand for fuel showed no signs of loosening any time soon. June futures contracts for West Texas Intermediate crude oil plunged as much as 68 percent to $6.50 a barrel — the lowest price in at least 50 years.
